answers.answer: Im 28 weeks along. I was 155 before pregnancy and now 181 so I understand. In all honesty, I don't know where all the weight has gone besides my belly and my boobs. But my doctor told me at my last one that I am gaining too much too fast as well. It made me sad but there isn't too much I can do about it. As long as I'm eating fairly healthy and exercising. I've been going to water aerobics lately at my gym (better on my back ), to hopefully help keep my weight down.

I'm also in the same boat. Started around 152 and right around 182.  The doctor spoke with me about my weight gain 2 appts ago and then thankfully at my last one I was only up 2lbs.  I was way too sock in my first trimester to keep up my workouts and unfortunately I'm one of those people that has to workout to keep the weight off.  I started back to working out but it hasn't been easy and I started a mean replacement shake in the morning.  But I'm craving sweets :-)
My appt. Went pretty good! I'm now 182. Were putting on pretty much the same weight

Just as long as you're eating healthy and watching your sugar intake because at this point is when women are diagnosed with gestational diabetes, causes weight gain and is harmful for the baby. Wishing you all a healthy, happy pregnancy
I didn't know that. I eat two bowls of cereal a day with lots of sugar and syrup with my pancakes

question: I'm so nervous that there gonna say I gained too much weight again. There rude when they say it. I'm pregnant and sensitive!  I was 156 now I'm 185. I don't know what there going to say.  Anyone else gaining weight to fast.
title: OB app today...NERVOUS
